required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Arm Crank Versus Treadmill Exercises on Heart Rate Variability in Adult Subjects.
clinical_study.official_title: Cardiovascular Responses to Arm Crank Exercise Versus to Treadmill Exercise in Adult Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: Cardiovascular response to exercise affects the capacity of all body organs depending upon intensity, duration and mode of exercises. The aim was to compare acute effects of arm crank with treadmill moderate intensity exercises on heart rate variability in normal participants.

detailed_description.textblock: A one hundred thirty male volunteers were equally and randomly assigned to; Group-I: Sixty-five participated in an arm crank moderate intensity exercise for 40 minutes. Group-II: Sixty-five participated in a treadmill moderate intensity exercise for 40 minutes. Halter heart rate monitor and automatic sphygmomanometer were used to measure heart beat intervals and arterial blood pressure respectively.

study_design_info.masking_description: by a blinded and independent research assistant who opened sealed envelopes that contained a computer-generated randomization card

primary_outcome.description: Autonomic functions of the heart was measured

arm_group.description: Sixty-five participated in an arm crank moderate intensity exercise for 40 minutes.
Sixty-five participated in a treadmill moderate intensity exercise for 40 minutes.

intervention.description: Each participant practiced on arm crank (Hudson) from long sitting position for 40 minutes. Seat's height and distance were adjusted to achieve full extension of subject arms at horizontal shoulder-level position

Participant practiced on an electronic computerized treadmill for 40 minutes . participant began warming up with lowest speed treadmill exercise for 5 minutes at zero inclination. Treadmill speed was increased gradually to achieve the pre-determined individualized moderate intensity for 30 minutes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Normal adult non-obese male subjects , their age ranges from 25-36 years.
- They were asymptomatic for cardiovascular and respiratory diseases.
- They currently did not receive any medical prescriptions.
- All participants were asked to avoid strenuous exercise, give up caffeine and alcohol beverages to have sufficient rest for 2 days before measurement sessions to avoid any carry over effects of stimulants or depressants on autonomic functions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any participant had medical history of cardiovascular and pulmonary disorders or received any interfering medications with study was excluded

link.description: Description it is a scientific location

results_reference.citation: White DW, Raven PB. Autonomic neural control of heart rate during dynamic exercise: revisited. J Physiol. 2014 Jun 15;592(12):2491-500. doi: 10.1113/jphysiol.2014.271858. Epub 2014 Apr 22. Review.
